Uses of Class
org.freeinternals.format.png.Chunk

  • Packages that use Chunk 
    Package Description
    org.freeinternals.format.png  

    • Uses of Chunk in org.freeinternals.format.png

      Subclasses of Chunk in org.freeinternals.format.png 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  Chunk_bKGD
      The bKGD chunk specifies a default background color to present the image against.
      class  Chunk_cHRM
      Applications that need device-independent specification of colors in a PNG file can use the cHRM chunk to specify the 1931 CIE x,y chromaticities of the red, green, and blue primaries used in the image, and the referenced white point.
      class  Chunk_gAMA
      The gAMA chunk specifies the relationship between the image samples and the desired display output intensity as a power function.
      class  Chunk_hIST
      The hIST chunk gives the approximate usage frequency of each color in the color palette.
      class  Chunk_IDAT
      The IDAT chunk contains the actual image data.
      class  Chunk_IEND
      Image trailer.
      class  Chunk_IHDR
      Image header.
      class  Chunk_iTXt
      This chunk is semantically equivalent to the tEXt and zTXt chunks, but the textual data is in the UTF-8 encoding of the Unicode character set instead of Latin-1.
      class  Chunk_pHYs
      The pHYs chunk specifies the intended pixel size or aspect ratio for display of the image.
      class  Chunk_PLTE
      The PLTE chunk contains from 1 to 256 palette entries.
      class  Chunk_sBIT
      The sBIT chunk is provided in order to store the original number of significant bits.
      class  Chunk_sPLT
      This chunk can be used to suggest a reduced palette to be used when the display device is not capable of displaying the full range of colors present in the image.
      class  Chunk_tEXt
      Textual information that the encoder wishes to record with the image can be stored in tEXt chunks.
      class  Chunk_tIME
      The tIME chunk gives the time of the last image modification (not the time of initial image creation).
      class  Chunk_tRNS
      The tRNS chunk specifies that the image uses simple transparency: either alpha values associated with palette entries (for indexed-color images) or a single transparent color (for gray scale and true color images).
      class  Chunk_zTXt
